title: Is it even worth pinging/communicating with your team?
body:
Hiya :)

Over the past games I've noticed no matter how many times I ping MIA, say where the Jungler is, warn my team that someone is roaming, they almost never listen.

Take my most recent game: Orianna vs Taliyah Mid. As soon as she hit 6 I typed "Tali 6, will roam". She went into fog of war and I pinged MIA, spammed careful to the pushed Bot Lane, and typed "Tali going Bot". Of course, 20-30 seconds later the text "Taliyah has slain ________ for a Double Kill" appears.

She comes back to lane, disappears, I warn my team (and top because he was pushed), and BOOM! they die 20s later...

The same happens in other games where I mention "[Enemy Jungler] is top, don't push". Naturally, they push and die.

So what I'm wondering: is it even worth pinging and communicating with your team if they're not even going to listen anyway?

Thanks :)

replies.body: It is the responsibility of everyone to ensure proper communication. The fact is, you are doing right by your allies. Don't let the fact they are doing wrong by you discourage you. You'll come across people who take note of proper communication, and participate themselves, eventually, and those are the kinds of people you are communicating for. Don't let them (and, not to mention, you) suffer just because there's a bunch of "tunnel visioned" players out there.

people mute pings, people ignore pings, at least by pinging you become more aware of what's happening in the game and you begin to start thinking more proactively about counterganking or counter roaming, or just showing in and getting some chip damage on tower and making them lose cs.
You're in BRONZE 4 and you are asking why people can't communicate? Take a guess
